This game is fun when you are good but take a break and you will get raped is the general rule of thumb. The ranking system is wak and you will be ^olestet against your will. You will be haveing multiple horrible games in a row where you get camped, targeted and some times you even get to be sacrificed by your team mates. All in all there is nothing funnier then being chased for a long time and narrowly escaping every time the killer get close only to almost get cought again. This game is filled with mind games and mind gaming the killer is also one of the high points.

It's definitely worth getting!

it's good depending on your play-style. this game has one game-mode however can offer a variety of characters to offer up different perks and powers, that being said, that's all the variety there is in the game, your character you play, the perks, the skill of the opponent, and the map. which can be fun, but for some people, not for long. some of my friends enjoyed the game for the first few months of playing it, but got bored and are wondering why i'm still playing it. in which case, its because i enjoy the variety in the survivors skill level, the excitement of getting better, or even mastering the game (which i believe to be impossible); i enjoy going against good players, losing then thinking of ways i could've won, so in the case i go against someone like that again, i can apply my new strategy. so simply, learning strategies and counter-strategies, like in a sport; i just feel the want to get better than the opponent.
the game is great and i suggest to watch about the game before buying it but over all the game is good

The developers decided to remove Leatherface's Claudette mask due to it supposedly acting as a tool for [b]"racism"[/b], even going so far as to claim it is akin to [b]blackface[/b].

This does a fantastic job at highlighting the joke known as: Dead by Daylight's development team. Behaviour Interactive are a company more concerned with appearing politically correct than genuinely improving their game and the experience of those who play it - bar the vocal minority who complain over such matters as those highlighted in this review.

Fun Game. If you want to play with friends you can queue up as survivors or if you are in the mood for murdering others  there is solo killer mode as well. The mechanics and gameplay are simple so anyone can enjoy it. That being said the skill ceiling for this game is pretty high both in survivor and killer modes. 

There are some killers (players) that absolutely destroy you and your team , on the other hand i've had my fair share of being bullied by high skilled survivors.

Fun. Very grindy, though. If you have a lot of time to sit down and learn it, it can become real enjoyable. Yeah, there are "gamebreaking" things but they are on both sides. You can opt to use them or not. Very sensitive/toxic community though. If you can not let it get to you, you should be fine. Gameplay loop at its base is enjoyable.

Я научился играть! Все просто, докупаешь канибала бубу, ловиш одного сурва, и кемпишь, когда его пытаются снять заводиш пилу и вот у тебя уже два сурва, далее, стараешся отнести его в подвал и там кемпиш, а затем сризаешь всех как гребочки в лесу, это лучшая тактика от генраша. Сколько слитых пати, подпаленых жоп в чате, ммм, отрада проста,  с помощью данного способа я стал изучать иностранные слова, правда матереные, в основном, но все же.
Норм
fun

Like: the grind, aesthetics, the maps, varieties of killers/survivors/perks, the lore, and the music.

Dislike: MMR (only have 29 hours played but seem to get paired with players with hundreds of hours played), certain play styles by killers/survivors, add-ons, and voice lines.

Overall I do recommend this game, it is a fun game to play with or without friends. The fundamental design of this game is a genius idea; despite any problems with certain balancing. The only major flaw in this game seems to be MMR, some games MMR seems to work fine, but other games it just doesn't make any sense. There should be two game options with a regular casual listing, and some type of ranked/SBMM listing.

Я долго думал над тем что поставить этой игре. Она одновременно и хороша, и одновременно пиздецки плоха. Таких различных эмоций вы наверное не получите ни в одной игре. В ней непохожий на другие игры геймплей, есть даже какая не какая спортивная составляющая в ней есть куда расти и где развлечься. НО прочувствовав всю боль в этой игре вы поймёте что она говно, разрабам абсолютно похуй на игру, в ней очень много проблем: баги,много багов, читеры, да кому то может повезти и за 1к часов вы не наткнётесь ни на одного читера, ужасная поддержка от разработчиков(долгое исправление проблем, никакой связи с комньюнити и т.д.) разработчики выпускают новые главы, не обращая внимание на проблемы геймплея, им всё равно что основа игры сломана главное выпустить новый контент. Но я продолжу играть возможно BHVR возьмуться за голову в один светлый день...

Yo lo recomiendo y aunque al principio cuesta pillarle el truco con unas horas es suficiente para entender la dinámica de juego.

Very, very good game

A pesar de que tengo pocas horas en el juego, y los innumerables casos de malas experiencias que tuve en el(por el ping, que si bien no es muy alto, pero, los golpes son muy falsos y más cuando se trata de los hachazos de cazadora), lo recomendaría. Es un juego altamente cooperativo, en el que jugar con amigos incluso lo hace aún mejor. Tiene su toque de originalidad y es bastante activo(se siguen agregando constantemente asesinos y survivors), lo cuál aumenta su variabilidad. Aunque muchos se quejen por el Genrush(KILLERS) y otros por el campeo y tuneleo(SURVIVORS), es un juego en el que, la forma de jugar no debería estar "prohibida", así, si queres jugar campeando, los survivors deberían idear una estrategia para poder contrarrestarlo. Sin embargo y dejando eso de lado, tanto del lado, Killer como Survivor es bastante interesante. Generalmente juego más de survivor, pero, cuando juego de killer igual la paso bien. SON INNEGABLES, los casos de Tbag, clicky clicky con la linterna, pero, matar a la gente que se "cree superior o toxiquea", ya sea, de una manera limpia o "sucia"(tuneleo, campeo), es lo más satisfactorio. Es un juego bastante interesante a mi parecer, he jugado más CS GO, o CS 1.6, pero, de haberlo jugado cuando apenas salió, definitivamente lo hubiera jugado mucho más.

[h1] The best time I had with this game was when I uninstalled it from my computer [/h1]

I say that with no joke. Uninstalling this game felt so liberating, and below are my reasons why. They're also reasons that u'll find are common sentiments in the community, especially among the killer mains. 

This game started out with a cool gameplay concept. However, it has been poorly executed. 
Large imbalance between Killer and Survivor with Survivors having massive advantages beneath the surface. 
Numerous killers have fallen completely out of meta, there is no way to practice killers other than Trapper vs bots unless u play against players, employs SBMM which has numerous problems of its own, survs being a party and using a 3rd party voice chat program to essentially cheat the system by always telling other players where the killer is. 

Player toxicity is [b] RAMPANT [/b] in matches, sometimes through killer facecamping (I personally did not experience this but have heard others talk about it), but mostly with survivors flashlight spamming (makes an audible and repetitive clicking noise) or teabagging right on the border before the exit gate, where the killer is blocked from picking them up if they get downed. This singlehandedly has destroyed my faith in the community. 

The grind for bloodpoints (currency used to upgrade character and unlock perks/add-ons) is reminiscent of rep grinding in WoW: long, tedious, and feels like it is not worth the experience. 

The only way to unlock new characters is by spending Iridescent Shards, a currency that is gained through leveling up (takes about 10-12 levels in order to receive enough shards to unlock a new character, which as u can imagine begins to get more and more difficult as time goes on, not to mention that u have to unlock both survivors and killers for access to perks), or by using Auric Cells which are gained in small quantities from event passes as you play during the event. You can also direct purchase Auric Cells with irl cash. 

But the worst part is that the Game Director, Mathieu Cote, [b] does not care about balancing the game [/b]. In his own words (you can find YouTube videos of this), anyone who has a problem with the game and getting frustrated about the poor balance should "go play some other game" during a Q&A session about one year ago. The devs seemingly have a bias against killers with how stagnant the survivor perk meta has become and there seems to be no motivation to actually make the killer experience enjoyable unless you are intentionally throwing the match to let survs win.  

As a result of this imbalance, survivor queues are steadily becoming longer and longer, upwards of 10 minutes last I played a couple months ago, although I am certain that has not changed in the time I have been away. Killers are simply tired of how the dev community has been treating them and the amount of toxicity they experience on a regular basis in matches. 

My recommendation is save your money and look at one of the other 4v1 PVMP games that are coming out. Do not give this dev studio your money until Cote and the rest of the dev team change their minds on balancing this game. It has so much potential and it is being wasted by a game director with an unjustifiably inflated ego.
